intro: Tarenna subsessilis, commonly known as the small-leaved tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, red berries that are edible but not widely consumed by humans. Tarenna subsessilis is often found in moist, shaded forest habitats.
